title: Visualisation functions for harp.
text: Visualization meteorological verification data harpVis provides functions plotting data produced harp packages, whether gridded forecast data harpIO verification data produced harpPoint harpSpatial. plotting functions (except plot_field()) use ggplot2 package background, meaning plots can saved ggsave(). addition direct plotting, harpVis provides shiny apps interactively displaying verification plots web browser, along option build apps modules.

what: Shiny module for picking colours — colour_choicesUI
title: Shiny module for picking colours — colour_choicesUI
text: UI includes button palette icon opening modal pick colours plot. output data frame can used control colours plotting point verification scores using plot_point_verif function.

text: id ID string module's UI input input reactive output output reactive session Session make child scope (default almost always used). verif_data verification data reactive value

text: reactive data frame used input colour_table argument plot_point_verif.

title: Shiny module for picking colours — colour_choicesUI
text: Note module uses "old" semantics shiny modules called callModule rather moduleServer.

title: Shiny module for picking colours — colour_choicesUI
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   colour_choicesUI("cols"),   plotOutput("verifPlot") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   col_table <- callModule(colour_choices, "cols", reactive(verif_data_ens))   output$verifPlot <- renderPlot({     plot_point_verif(       verif_data_ens, spread, colour_table = col_table(),       plot_num_cases = FALSE     )   }) }  if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: Co-ordinates for geofield geoms — coord_geo
text: basically just implementation coord_sf() geom_georaster. requires sf package much considered experimental. recommended use coord_equal() time errors likely.

title: Co-ordinates for geofield geoms — coord_geo
code: coord_geo(   xlim = NULL,   ylim = NULL,   expand = TRUE,   crs = NULL,   default_crs = sf::st_crs(4326),   datum = sf::st_crs(4326),   label_graticule = waiver(),   label_axes = waiver(),   lims_method = c("cross", "box", "orthogonal", "geometry_bbox"),   ndiscr = 100,   default = FALSE,   clip = "on" )

title: Co-ordinates for geofield geoms — coord_geo
text: xlim, ylim Limits x y axes. limits specified units default CRS. default, means projected coordinates (default_crs = NULL). limit specifications translate exact region shown plot can confusing non-linear rotated coordinate systems used default crs. First, different methods can preferable different conditions. See parameter lims_method details. Second, specifying limits along one direction can affect automatically generated limits along direction. Therefore, best always specify limits x y. Third, specifying limits via position scales xlim()/ylim() strongly discouraged, can result data points dropped plot even though visible final plot region. expand TRUE, default, adds small expansion factor limits ensure data axes overlap. FALSE, limits taken exactly data xlim/ylim. crs coordinate reference system (CRS) data projected plotting. specified, use CRS defined first sf layer plot. default_crs default CRS used non-sf layers (carry CRS information) scale limits. default value NULL means setting crs used. implies non-sf layers scale limits assumed specified projected coordinates. useful alternative setting default_crs = sf::st_crs(4326), means x y positions interpreted longitude latitude, respectively, World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS84). datum CRS provides datum use generating graticules. label_graticule Character vector indicating graticule lines labeled . Meridians run north-south, letters "N" "S" indicate labeled north south end points, respectively. Parallels run east-west, letters "E" "W" indicate labeled east west end points, respectively. Thus, label_graticule = "SW" label meridians south end parallels west end, whereas label_graticule = "EW" label parallels ends meridians . meridians parallels can general intersect side plot panel, choice label_graticule labels guaranteed reside one particular side plot panel. Also, label_graticule can cause labeling artifacts, particular graticule line coincides edge plot panel. circumstances, label_axes generally yield better results used instead. parameter can used alone combination label_axes. label_axes Character vector named list character values specifying graticule lines (meridians parallels) labeled side plot. Meridians indicated "E" (East) parallels "N" (North). Default "--EN", specifies (clockwise top) labels top, none right, meridians bottom, parallels left. Alternatively, setting specified list(bottom = "E", left = "N"). parameter can used alone combination label_graticule. lims_method Method specifying scale limits converted limits plot region. effect default_crs = NULL. non-linear CRS (e.g., perspective centered around North pole), available methods yield widely differing results, may want try various options. Methods currently implemented include "cross" (default), "box", "orthogonal", "geometry_bbox". method "cross", limits along one direction (e.g., longitude) applied midpoint direction (e.g., latitude). method avoids excessively large limits rotated coordinate systems means sometimes limits need expanded little extreme data points included final plot region. contrast, method "box", box generated limits along directions, limits projected coordinates chosen entire box visible. method can yield plot regions large. Finally, method "orthogonal" applies limits separately along axis, method "geometry_bbox" ignores limit information except bounding boxes objects geometry aesthetic. ndiscr Number segments use discretising graticule lines; try increasing number graticules look incorrect. default default coordinate system? FALSE (default), replacing coordinate system another one creates message alerting user coordinate system replaced. TRUE, warning suppressed. clip drawing clipped extent plot panel? setting "" (default) means yes, setting "" means . cases, default "" changed, setting clip = "" can cause unexpected results. allows drawing data points anywhere plot, including plot margins. limits set via xlim ylim data points fall outside limits, data points may show places axes, legend, plot title, plot margins.

title: Shiny module for point verification dashboard — dashboard_point_verifUI
code: # Run examples link doesn't work for shiny apps in RStudio. Copy-paste # example to console to run.  library(shiny)  # Set the theme to white shinyOptions(theme = "white")  ui <- fluidPage(   fluidRow(     column(12, dashboard_point_verifUI("dshbrd"))   ) )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   col_tbl <- data.frame(     fcst_model = unique(verif_data_ens$ens_summary_scores$fcst_model),     colour     = c("red", "blue")   )   callModule(     dashboard_point_verif, "dshbrd", reactive(verif_data_ens),     reactive(col_tbl), reactive("lead_time")   ) }  if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(ui, server) }

what: Download module for point verification plots in a Shiny app — download_verif_plotUI
title: Download module for point verification plots in a Shiny app — download_verif_plotUI
text: module's UI "Save" button opens modal user can select options related download plot. passing list options, following elements must included: "score"     - score plot.Must preceded name element verification list, e.g. "ens_summary_scores_mean_bias". "num_cases" - TRUE/FALSE - whether include number cases panel. "to_y_zero" - TRUE/FALSE - whether include 0 y axis. "x_axis"    - variable plot x axis. "facets"    - variables facet - unquoted wrapped vars. Set NULL faceting. "filters"   - filtering expressions - unquoted wrapped vars. Set NULL filtering. "line_cols" - variable set line colour aesthetic. "highlight" - deterministic verification ensemble members - member highlight. "flip_axes" - TRUE/FALSE - whether flip x y axes. n_cases_pos - position number cases panel.

title: Download module for point verification plots in a Shiny app — download_verif_plotUI
code: download_verif_plotUI(id)  download_verif_plot(   input,   output,   session,   verif_data,   score_options,   colour_table )

title: Download module for point verification plots in a Shiny app — download_verif_plotUI
text: id ID string module's UI input input reactive output output reactive session Session make child scope (default almost always used). verif_data verification data reactive value score_options reactive list options plot. list output interactive_point_verif. colour_table reactive data frame format suitable colour_table argument plot_point_verif

title: Download module for point verification plots in a Shiny app — download_verif_plotUI
code: library(shiny)  ui <- fluidPage(   download_verif_plotUI("dwnld") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   # Set options   opts <- list(     score       = "ens_summary_scores_spread",     num_cases   = FALSE,     to_y_zero   = FALSE,     x_axis      = "lead_time",     facets      = NULL,     filters     = NULL,     line_cols   = "fcst_model",     highlight   = NULL,     flip_axes   = FALSE,     n_cases_pos = "bottom"   )    col_tbl <- data.frame(     fcst_model = unique(verif_data_ens$ens_summary_scores$fcst_model),     colour     = c("red", "blue")   )    callModule(     download_verif_plot, "dwnld", reactive(verif_data_ens),     reactive(opts), reactive(col_tbl)   ) }  if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: 2d contours of a geofield — geom_geocontour

X-spline line drawn relative control points. control point, line may pass (interpolate) control point may approach (approximate) control point; behaviour determined shape parameter control point. shape parameter greater zero, spline approximates control points (similar cubic B-spline shape 1). shape parameter less zero, spline interpolates control points (similar Catmull-Rom spline shape -1). shape parameter 0, spline forms sharp corner control point. open X-splines, start end control points must shape 0 (non-zero values silently converted zero). open X-splines, default start end control points replicated curve drawn. curve drawn (interpolating approximating) second third set four control points, default behaviour ensures resulting curve starts first control point specified ends last control point. default behaviour can turned via repEnds argument.

title: Get map data for a given geodomain — get_map
text: data frame columns "x", "y", polygon = TRUE additional "group" column.

title: Get map data for a given geodomain — get_map
code: # Define a domain and make some data arr <- array(dim = c(200, 200)) for (i in 1:200) {   for (j in 1:200) {     arr[i, j] <- sin(i / 10) + sin(j / 10)   } }  dom <- define_domain(10, 60, 200, 10000) geo <- geofield(arr, domain = dom) data <- data.frame(geo = geolist(geo))  # Use polygons map <- get_map(geo) ggplot() +   geom_polygon(     aes(x, y, group = group), map,     fill = "seagreen", colour = "grey10"   ) +   geom_geocontour(aes(geofield = geo, colour = after_stat(level)), data) +   coord_equal(expand = FALSE) +   theme_harp_map()   # Use paths map <- get_map(geo, polygon = FALSE) ggplot() +   geom_georaster(aes(geofield = geo), data) +   geom_path(aes(x, y), map, colour = "grey30") +   coord_equal(expand = FALSE) +   theme_harp_map()

title: Plot verification scores — plot_point_verif
text: verif_data Output ens_verif, det_verif, harpPoint verification function individual scores. score score plot. name one columns verification tables name dervived score, spread_skill, spread_skill_ratio, brier_score_decomposition. verif_type type verification plot ensemble verification data. default "ens", set "det" plot verification scores members. set "det", also set colour_by = member. x_axis x-axis plot. default lead_time, also threshold. scores overrided. Note leadtime treated exactly lead_time compatibility older versions. y_axis y-axis plot. default take score input, scores overrided. rank_is_relative Logical. TRUE rank histograms plotted relative rank (0 1) x-axis. default FALSE. rank_hist_type rank histograms, plot can done bar chart, lollipop chart line chart. colour_by column colour plot lines bars . default fcst_model, model name. Set NULL lines / bars colour. colour_table data frame column names equal value colour_by "colour". colour column contain colour names hex codes. one row value colour_by column. set NULL, default colour table used. hex_palette colour palette use hexbin. vector colours. default plasma. hex_colour outline colour hexagons hexbin plots. default "grey20". extend_y_to_zero Logical. Whether extend y-axis include zero. plot_num_cases Logical whether inlcude number cases panel plot. currently works summary scores, facet_by set, number cases panel drawn since clutter plot. extend_num_cases_to_zero Logical whether extend axis number cases zero. default behaviour (FALSE) axis limits set minimum maximum number cases. num_cases_position position number cases panel relative score panel. Can "" (default), "", "left", "right". Typically "" "" work unless plotting vertical profile scores plot_profile_verif, "left" "right" can chosen. facet_by column(s) facet plot . Faceting term used generating plot panels. argument must wrapped inside vars function - e.g. facet_by = vars(threshold). num_facet_cols Number columns faceted plot. facet_scales facet scales fixed ("fixed", default), free ("free"), free one dimension ("free_x", "free_y")? facet_labeller function used label title strip. Typically always "label_value", column used facet_by contains plotmath expressions, "label_parsed" used. See labellers information. linetype_by column set line types plot . line_width width lines plot. default 1.1. point_size size points plot. Set 0 points. default 2. filter_by Filter data plotting. Must wrapped inside vars function. can useful making single plot many groups. example, reliability one plot lead time threshold, data can filtered e.g. filter_by = vars(lead_time == 12, threshold == 280). plot_title Title plot. Set "auto" automatically generate title. Set "none" title. Anything else inside quotes used plot title. plot_subtitle Subtitle plot. Set "auto" automatically generate subtitle. Set "none" subtitle. Anything else inside quotes used plot subtitle. plot_caption Caption plot. Set "auto" automatically generate caption Set "none" caption. Anything else inside quotes used plot caption. x_label Label x-axis. Set "auto" automatically generate label data. Set "none" label. Anything else inside quotes used x-axis label. y_label Label y-axis. Set "auto" automatically generate label data. Set "none" label. Anything else inside quotes used y-axis label. legend_position position legends ("none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top", two-element numeric vector). num_legend_rows maximum number rows legend. log_scale_x Logical - whether plot x-axis log scale. log_scale_y Logical - whether plot y-axis log scale. flip_axes Logical whether swap x y axes. typically used function called plot_profile_verif. colour_theme colour theme plot - can ggplot2 theme (see theme_grey), "theme_harp_grey", "theme_harp_midnight", "theme_harp_black". base_size base font size. base_family base font family. base_line_size base size line elements. base_rect_size base size rect elements. ... Arguments aes e.g. group = ...

title: Plot a time series for point data — plot_station_ts
text: ensemble forecasts, data manipulation done prior plotting depending geom listed . geoms included , manipulation done plots may difficult interpret work . boxplot - data grouped x_axis argument box representative ensemble distribution point x-axis. See geom_boxplot hinges, whiskers outliers defined. violin - data grouped x_axis argument "violin" representative ensemble distribution point x-axis. line - data grouped ensemble member time series plotted member. common ensemble "spaghetti" plot. ribbon - data divided bands depending quantiles provided quantiles argument. bands centred outer band lowest highest quantiles inner bands added innermost pair quantiles reached. Consequently even number quantiles must provided. col - data divided bands increasing quantile pairs starting provided quantiles argument, minimum value (quantile = 0). gives columns stacked probabilities staring 0 particularly useful accumulated variables precipitation, variables truncate 0 wind speed cloud cloud cover. "best_guess" forecast can added plot using best_guess argument. can either name function reduces ensemble single value (e.g. "mean", "median"), ensemble member treat best guess (e.g. 0, "mbr000"). geom options can provided via best_guess_geom best_guess_geom_args arguments, must geoms understand x y aesthetics.

title: Plot a time series for point data — plot_station_ts
text: default, data function given plotted. many cases can result overplotting. data one station (SID), one forecast start time (fcst_dttm), arguments filter data prior plotting based values. Alternatively multi-panel plots can made using facet_by argument. groups data based values columns provided facet_by plots group data panel. default behaviour plot 1 column panels x axis lines panels, can changed using num_facet_cols argument. title: harpVis v0.2.0
text: major update. main focus ensuring plot functions verification scores can handle outputs harpPoint 0.2.0 also backwards compatible outputs older versions harpPoint. addition new functionalities. particular new geoms plotting harp georeferenced gridded data ggplot, options thin data speed plotting.

title: harpVis v0.2.0
text: plot_scatter() soft deprecated. Since data computed verification functions, scatter (accurately hexbin) plots can now made plot_point_verif(..., score = hexbin) plot_station_eps() defunct. plot_station_ts() used instead.

title: harpVis v0.2.0
text: Plot functions backwards compatible verification data produced old versions {harpPoint} leadtime, mname, fcdate, validdate included column names still work. geom_georaster(), geom_geocontour() geom_geocontour_filled() new functions plotting gridded data using ggplot. upscaling option added enable faster plotting rasters calculation / smoothing contours. Map data plots projected domain gridded data field can retrieved using get_map(). shiny app point verification can now select different time axes recognise plot vertical profile verifications. shiny app point verification gained two new options: full_dir_navigation controls whether modal opened selecting data directories (old behaviour), simply populating dropdown selector. theme allows control overall appearance app can choose “dark”, “light” “white”.

title: harpVis v0.0.9
text: version basically unchanged since late 2021 / early 2022. officially tagged v0.0.9 November 2023
